summary: This bill, H.R. 840, aims to nullify a final rule issued by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service regarding the endangered species status and critical habitat designations for several freshwater mussel species in Texas. The bill specifically targets the rule titled "Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Endangered Species Status With Critical Habitat for Guadalupe Fatmucket, Texas Fatmucket, Guadalupe Orb, Texas Pimpleback, Balcones Spike, and False Spike, and Threatened Species Status With Section 4(d) Rule and Critical Habitat for Texas Fawnsfoot," stating that the rule "shall have no force or effect." The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on January 31, 2025.
